events.name: Big Data & Analytics Innovation Summit 2017 - Day 2
events.description: Day 2 of Big Data & Analytics Innovation Summit 2017, a 2 day event hosted by Innovation Enterprise. You must register with the event to book your seat. Description: "Leverage Big Data To Maximize Business Performance" Why Attend? Learn how to organize your data science team and tools so you can increase productivity whilst democratising the knowledge produced.  For those at the start of the data journey, learn how to construct an effective data strategy from the ground up so your organization never falls behind the curve. Enjoy pro-active and organized networking opportunities to build new business relationships and opportunities inspired by others in your field. Get to grips with the world’s latest and most advanced data tools and technologies to optimize your testing phase. And benchmark your organization’s data initiatives against your competitors and across different industries. More information here:  https://theinnovationenterprise.com/summits/big-data-singapore-2017 Agenda: Thursday, March 2 08:00 - Registration & Breakfast 08:50 - Chairperson Overview  09:00 - Real-time Analytics at Uber 09:30 - Set Up Data Strategy: From Technology Domain to Business Domain 10:00 - Analytics in Corporate Real Estate 10:30 - Coffee Break - Exhibition Area  11:00 - The Art of Data Science 11:30 - Data Driven Marketing (Segmentation, Audience Management, Measurement & Attribution) 12:00 - Web Analytics isn’t boring! 12:30 - Yesterdays Data making Todays Investment Decisions 13:00 - Lunch 14:00 - 16:30 - Big Data Strategy 14:00 - 16:30 - Smart Cities 17:00 - End of Summit ****You must register with the event to book your seat**** How to Register: https://theinnovationenterprise.com/summits/big-data-singapore-2017/registration For deeper engagement with Apache Apex, download, view past meetup webinars, slides, and docs.  To reduce time to market, look at operable app-templates that you can quickly import and launch.  Examples: HDFS-Sync, Kafka-HDFS, HDFS-Line-Copy, S3-HDFS and HDFS-Kafka. Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for qualifying startups. Check it out! Brought to you by DataTorrent, creators of Apache Apex.
events.location: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel, 392 Havelock Road, Singapore 169663
events.group_name: Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data Apex Users Group, Singapore

events.name: AI meets IoT
events.description: What if Things Start to Think  Artificial intelligence will enable the vast number of connected “things” online, and will be even more important in making sense of an almost endless sea of data streamed in from these devices. ***************************************************************** This meetup is co-hosted with IoT Asia 2017.   Bring along your business cards, there will be lucky draws for 5 conference passes! To learn more about IoT Asia and IoTSG collaboration, checkout here ***************************************************************** Speaker for the evening <a>Setu Chokshi</a>  Technology Innovation Leader, Asia Pacific, India, China at Nielsen ***************************************************************** DATE & AGENDA: Thursday, 2nd March 2017 • 06:30 pm – Registration & Networking  over snacks (F&B Sponsored by IoT Asia!) • 06:55 pm – Introduction by CK  • 07:00 pm – How AI meets IoT by CK • 07:30 pm – Machine Learning 101 and use cases by Setu Chokshi • 08:15 pm –  QnA & Lucky Draw • 08:30 pm - Networking continued ************************************************************  VENUE: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01, SG139951 ************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Fireside chat with Srivas - Uber Chief Data Architect
events.description:
Please note of our new attendance policy. Attendees are REQUIRED to RSVP to the event to be allowed into the venue. People who are neither in the "going" nor "wait" lists will be turned away. Registration is necessary due to the security clearance to access the location. 

RSVP - Opens: 1200, 25th February 2017 - Closes: 2000, 1st March 2017   In this upcoming meetup, we are having a fireside chat with M. C. Srivas, who is the Chief Data Architect at Uber. Post (Data Only Related) questions you have here: https://goo.gl/LmsqzY Potential topics include:  - overview of data at Uber. - how integral is it to the business, - is there a philosophy? - how accessible is it for the average staff member, - Data Architecture.   - Platform stack and s caling.   - New frontiers: what are Uber's challenges? - What do you think that people that are going from "small" big data to "big" big data should know? Event details - 1830-1900: Networking [casual; small talk]- 1900-2000: Topic to be confirmed- 2000-2030: Networking [casual; small talk] [] : Suggested rating and topic; ranges from:newbie - casual - core - hardcore.  Speakers As chief data architect at Uber, M. C. Srivas worries about all data issues from trips, riders and partners, and pricing to analytics, self-driving cars, security, and data-center planning. Previously, M. C. was CTO and founder of MapR Technologies, a top Hadoop distribution; worked on search at Google, developing and running the core search engine that powered many of Google’s special verticals like ads, maps, and shopping; was chief architect at Spinnaker Networks (now Netapp), which formed the basis of Netapp’s flagship NAS products; and ran the Andrew File System team at Transarc, which was acquired by IBM. M. C. holds an MS from the University of Delaware and a BTech from IIT Linkedin profile  Please note of our new attendance policy. Attendees are REQUIRED to RSVP to the event to be allowed into the venue. People who are neither in the "going" nor "wait" lists will be turned away. Registration is necessary due to the security clearance to access the location.
events.location: IMDA PIXEL Labs@NDC,  111 Middle Road #03-04, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969

events.name: Startup Trio & Demo, Workshop Display
events.description:
Hey guys, This will be the first of many to come Startup & Demo, Workshop Display series of events we have planned for you. The objective of such a demo pitch will be to show case live/near live application use cases of Ethereum blockchain and the startups that have been pouring their time and effort into their works.  Speaker 1: Otonomos, Mano Thanabalan (CTO)  7pm Speaker 2: Digix, Chris Hitchott (Core Dev) 7:35pm Speaker 3: Attores, Gaurang Torvekar (CTO) 8:10pm 


Applications to speak on the next session (sometime in May-June) are open, please feel free to drop me a message or email and let me know on what topics you will like to present. They will have to be a project that is open-sourced, community based and useful for developers and alike to be exposed to the utility of developing on Ethereum.  I look forward to hearing from you and your RSVP. If you have any questions, please feel free to comment on below and we will take them at the Q&A segment Registration begins at 6:30pm Event Organizers:    


Venue Sponsor:  Cheers,Shaun & Gaurang Organizers of Ethereum Singapore

events.description:
前回お話していた、旧正月バージョンの新年会をやりましょう！！　 皆様奮ってご参加ください。 

場所はチャイナタウンの東北人家を予約します。 http://singapore.navi.com/food/168/ 

今回ちょっと都合が合わなかったんですが、次回は土日を使ってライトニングトーク会かもくもく会など、飲み会以 外のことを企画します。
events.location: 東北人家, 22 Upper cross street Singapore, 058334

events.name: [GCPUG] Managing Kubernetes deployments with Helm
events.description: For those who aren't members of the GCP User Group, we have a event coming up next week covering App deployment on Kubernetes with Helm. No RSVPs will be accepted here, please RSVP at https://www.meetup.com/GCPUGSG/events/237842365/ Overview This is a follow up on the Kubernetes workshops held Q4 2016, so this is a slightly more advanced topic (attendees should be familiar with basic Kubernetes concepts).  Kubernetes lets you efficiently run applications distributed across a cluster of hosts and keep all services up even in the face of failures. In this Meetup we will focus on running applications on Kubernetes. We'll start with a short introduction to Docker and container orchestration so participants without prior experience with container technologies can keep up.
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70, Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117371
